Event.0: New Zealand mountain climber and explorer Sir Edmund Hillary—who, with the Tibetan mountaineer Tenzing Norgay, was the first to summit Mount Everest—died.
Event.1: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission approved the merger of America Online and Time Warner, and AOL Time Warner (since shortened to Time Warner) stock began trading the next morning.
Event.3:
Mary J. Blige
American singer-songwriter
was born
Event.4: 1st government report warning by US Surgeon General Luther Terry that smoking may be hazardous
Event.5: U.S. Surgeon General Luther L. Terry announced that cigarette smoking is linked to lung cancer.
Event.6: LaMar Clark sets pro boxing record of 44 consecutive knockouts
Event.7:
Amelia Earhart's Hawaii-to-California flight
On this day in 1935, Amelia Earhart, one of the world's most celebrated aviators, made the first successful solo flight from Hawaii to California, a distance longer than that from the United States to Europe.
Event.8: Louis B. Mayer head of film studio MGM announces creation of Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
Event.9: Novelist Hermann Hesse (36) weds singer Ruth Wenger
Event.10: Insulin first used on humans to treat diabetes, on Leonard Thompson, 14, of Canada
Event.11: Actress Hattie McDaniel (16) weds pianist Howard Hickman (30)
Event.12: Japanese politician Suzuki Zenkō, who served as prime minister (1980–82), was born in Yamada, Iwate prefecture, Japan.
Event.13: Painter Paul Gauguin marries Teha'amana, a 13-year-old Tahitian girl
Event.14:
Alice Paul
American suffragist
was born
Event.15: Milk was delivered for the first time in glass bottles in New York City.
Event.16: Alabama seceded from the Union, the fourth state to do so in the run-up to the American Civil War.
Event.17:
Harry Gordon Selfridge
British merchant
was born
Event.18:
William James
American psychologist and philosopher
was born
Event.19: First public demonstration of telegraph message sent using dots & dashes at Speedwell Ironworks, Morristown, New Jersey by Samuel Morse and Alfred Vail
Event.20: Alexander Hamilton, the first secretary of the U.S. Treasury, was born in the British West Indies.
Event.21:
Alexander Hamilton
United States statesman
was born
Event.22: Jacob van Neck's fleet leaves Bantam, Java in modern day Indonesia with 1 million pounds of pepper and cloves and a further half a ship full of nutmeg, mace and cinnamon
